meanings.definition: A group of people working together, especially for criminal or violent purposes.
meanings.sent1: The gang of robbers planned the bank heist carefully.
meanings.sent2: The police arrested the gang responsible for the vandalism.
meanings.sent3: The gang of thieves accidentally locked themselves out of the getaway car.
meanings.sent4: The gang of bullies ruled the schoolyard with fear.
meanings.sent5: The gang of pirates sailed the seas in search of treasure.

meanings.definition: A group of young people who associate closely and often exclusively for social reasons, especially such a group engaging in delinquent behavior.
meanings.sent1: The teenage gang hung out at the abandoned warehouse after school.
meanings.sent2: The neighborhood kids formed a gang to play basketball together.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous gang of friends decided to prank their teacher.
meanings.sent4: The close-knit gang of siblings always had each other's backs.
meanings.sent5: The rebellious gang of teenagers spray-painted graffiti on the walls.
